reviewText:
This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer/publisher.
Burgers is a side scrolling action game, developed and published by storm_sharks.  I am going to start out by saying, from the screenshots this game reminded me a lot of games like Castle Crashers, and Metal Slug, so was quite excited to try it out. Sadly what followed was quite possibly one of my worst gaming experiences of my entire life, and I’m talking Slaughtering Grounds levels of bad.

The game play idea is very simple, as with other side scrolling action games, you progress to the right hand side of your screen taking out enemies as you go, somehow this game doesn’t manage to even do that concept very well. Let’s start off with the controls, you obviously cannot miss them because as soon as you start the game, BAM there they are in your face very obnoxiously…at the start of every level too. There is a nice feature that I have not seen in games before, where you press a button and you can move backwards rather than moving the directional stick, I thought it was quite cool, only when I found out you couldn’t actually shoot whilst moving…so it turned out to be quite a pointless addition.  Most levels you will almost always run out of ammo for your weapons. This is infuriating when you are only about half way through the stage, and you have a trail of bad guys chasing you because you aren’t able to kill them, how do you get more ammo you ask? By killing bad guys…ironic huh.

The art style in Burgers is probably its only redeeming feature. The cartoon look to it really pleased the eye and most of the animations were done really well too. The background environments are almost just a copy and paste throughout the stage as you can see the copy point quite clearly.  Next, we have the sound effects, or a better wording would be, the lack of. The only sounds you will get out of this game are the sound of your automatic rifle and the sound of bullets landing on your foes. Nothing else. Seriously, nothing. The flamethrower gun makes no sound. Enemies charging at you, make no sound. No soundtrack, I thought maybe the game had bugged so reinstalled it, nope, nothing – it is seriously bad.

The game can be easy or hard, depending on how well you are at conserving your ammo and how quick you are at picking up the controls. I couldn’t get past the last level because of the poorly designed control system and, you guessed it, lack of ammo. I have been playing for just over an hour and have no intention to ever pick this game up again.

There aren’t any actual technical problems, what is there in the game does work, it just doesn’t make sense. I ran it on 1440p without any problems at 60 fps, but of course, it’s never going to be the most taxing of games on any modern day rig.

To sum up, Burgers, is 100% definitely the worst game I have played in the past 12 months, and it quite possibly the worst game I have ever played in my entire life. I am still shocked at how bad the sound department is of this game and the poorly produced gameplay. Do not give this game any time of day, even at £1,99 this game is not worth a single penny.

2) Not Recommended
3) Only recommended when on sale

6) This is a must play

reviewText:
VERDICT: Burgers is a casual and very short, WW2 themed, side-scrolling twin-stick shooter made using Unity.  The only campaign can be played in singleplayer or coop mode.

For the most part the game is a let down with not enough levels of play, and those that are there are over too quickly.  The nice cartoony graphics and fast-moving gameplay make it hard to dislike.  The controls are rock-solid but the audio somewhat underwhelming.  Characters and weapons can be swapped in-game but only between playing sessions.  It seems that the developers may have been going for a free game with MT options for the weaponary and character selections but changed their minds during development.

There is a promising core of minimal features and gameplay in Burgers but at the moment it is far from being a product I could recommend.  Its lack of seriousness makes the game endearing but only worth a look if brought in a sale.  In short its a budget title that might be worth a dollar to someone.  Just because I dont recommend it, it doesnt mean you wont like it.


... More info below ...


01. GENRE: Casual, side-scrolling, twin-stick shooter

02. SETTING: Alternative monster-ridden World War II theme

03. STORY/BACKGROUND: You play the role of a German soldier towards the end of the war (or other character) in an area that is about to become infested by alien looking monsters controlled by evil mind-controlling sphere.

04. GAME MODES: There is only one campaign comprising of seven or so levels, which do not have to be played sequentially once unlocked.  It can be played in single-player and coop modes.

05. GAMEPLAY/MECHANICS: Only basic gameplay makes it into this game.  Basic movement, shooting direction, weapon changes and  ammo pick-ups are about all there is.  Enemies come in a few guises and some hide behind cover, while boss battles happen across most of the campaign levels.

There is a shop that uses credits earned for completing missions to buy new or upgraded weapons and change starting characters.  There are quite a few to choose from even if you can only carry three weapons (main rifle, pistol and knife.)  You also receive a handful of grenades which are best kept for bosses or vehicles/tanks.

Levelling is automatic with XP earned shown at the end of a mission, auto-upgrading character stats and unlocking the most powerful weapons.

While there is little wrong with the design I did find it somewhat minimal and inconsistent in terms of the game's overall vision.  Seems the devs may have started out making a game with MTs and then changed their minds.  Unless of course there is an iOS/tablet version which I would not have heard of.

06. ENEMIES: As you would expect from a side-scroller enemies appear from the right of the screen and are fairly static therefore only providing a challenge in numbers or with higher protection.  There is a low to fair mix of enemies; humans in the guise of armed civilians or German soldiers together with a mashing of different aliens collectively form the mass of enemies you will face.  There are some bosses to defeat but only your inability to control your character will stop you from progressing.

07. LEVEL/GAME DESIGN: In keeping with expectations game design is basic.  It works as a twin-stick shooter and my general feeling was that while it is devoid of alot of detail a good core was there to build upon.

08. A.I: Basic.  Unfortunately with most of the action appearing from the right of screen there are not many surprises and thus it doesnt need to be much more.

09. CONTROLS: I used keyboard by default.  Optionally mouse can be used for shooting.  Overall they are solid and responsive.  Can also use controller but did not do so during my play sessions.

10. GRAPHICS: Very good.  Cartoony.  Depictions of soldiers and enemies are cute if nothing else.  Backdrops are limited to two or three locations with slight varations to give that extra dimension.  Perhaps the games best graphics are the representations of the weapons taken from WW2 and beyond.  Though the sprinkling of cutscenes that explain the story are apt.  Sadly though thats it.

11. SOUNDTRACK & AUDIO: Not so great. The in-game sounds are fine but the soundtracks seems to be (mostly) a collection of off-the-shelf tunes and melodies.  Some seem to fit the game's ambience while others do not.  The music just doesnt add anything positive to the whole ambience.

12. VOICE ACTING: None.

13. CHALLENGE/DIFFICULTY: Played on Normal difficulty and it was much easier than it should be.  Only the bosses provided some challenge and some vehicles move too fast to be avoided.  Luckly you dont die straight away and can muddle through.

14. PROBLEMS: No problems encountered but I did not try coop so I dont know if there are problem with that.  There doesnt seem to be any major issues on looking through the steam forums.

15. ACHIEVEMENTS: An achievement hunters dream.  Five very basic achievements, two can be gained very easily, just by playing.  Two more from shop purchases and the final one is gained by completeing the final level.

16. DLC: None, unsurprisingly.

17. ONLINE PLAY/COMMUNITY: Did not try coop play.

18. ENJOYMENT/APPEAL: Its a very basic game and there is very little to challenge players.  That said it may only appeal to those players who like casual shooters or want a hour or two of harmless fun with their friends in coop.

19. PLAYTIME/LONGEVITY/REPLAYABILITY: For single-player you can expect to get just over one hours enjoyment out of it.  Maybe two at a stretch.  Coop could take a few hours more possibly to five or six with repeat play.  Only more if you grow attached to it.

20. VALUE FOR MONEY: I cant see it being worth more than a dollar/pound/euro.  Others may disagree.  It depend though how many drinking sessions you find you want to play this.  I could be wrong but I cant see many players playing it past completing it the once.  Afterall there are many other coop shooters out there to enjoy with friends.

Early Access Review

Let me start by saying that I am a huge fan of action/indie/platformer games, and I have to say the ideas of this game are very good and also playing it is fun. So basically Burgers is an action shooter indie game with simple cartoonish visuals. You play as a soldier during the war against Nazi and their mutation monsters. The story is not really anything special or completely new, it's just simple like that but it works.

Action side is done very well and it is absolutely stunning! You will get to use all kinds of cool weapons and characters. All the weapons are entertaining to use and that feeling when shooting a gun, so satisfying. You will get ammo for the weapons quite often, but in case you run out of ammo, knife is also a powerful weapon, but a little slow. If the game ends up being too easy for you, you can always crank up the difficulty to your own personal preference! I recommend Burgers to those who are fan of action indie games, just like me. It's an entertaining and enjoyable experience and I had so much fun playing it.

And one more thing I have to say, Burgers is a first release from a small team named storm_sharks, so don't judge them too hard, they really did a great job. Positive feedback is needed here, it gives motivation to the developers as well as players that are wanting to buy the game.

PROs- Great concept
- Simple, Enjoyable, Relaxing & Challenging
- Run smoothly in new windows generation (me windows 10), I've had no performance issues myself
- Many fun weapons to use

CONs- Co-op mode can't be played online (at this time is 'Local wifi only')
- Too simple animation

Conclusion:
worth the price and worth playing.

reviewText:
The first impressions I had from this game were not the best at first but it quickly changed my mind once I gave a fair shot. Burgers is inspired by games like Castle Crashers where mindless co-op fun takes place. The idea is not original at all but I see this is coming from a new developer in the industry so consider that when providing useful feedback or even when playing the game.

The story is about a group of soldiers who were deployed for a mission that turned out to be more dangerous than expected and not with the enemies they had in mind. In order to save the world (cliché, I know) they have to ignore their main mission for a greater cause. At your disposal, you have several sorts of weapons that you can buy with some funny names with different designs as well. As you advance in the game you will level up and acquire money for said weapons which will become very useful in later levels. Speaking of the levels, there aren’t many of them and I guess that the small price reflects on the small content the game has to offer. Still, it can be a quick side distraction for those dead hours or if you just want a quick gaming session without having to worry about complex tutorials or something similar.

At this point there is no local co-op which can be a deal breaker for some, however I believe that this a feature that will planned for their next game. Still, it was a big missed opportunity. In the end, I believe this game can be worth your time, just don’t expect a quality story driven game or even a original concept, otherwise you will be disappointed.

reviewText:
This game reminds me a bit of Zombieville USA. Only it's not a mobile game and it's on Steam. I played about half an hour of it and it didn't appeal to me. For the first four levels you shoot things that follow you. Actually the first level was unique in that the AI had guns and shot back. After that initial stage it turned into some German alien war game which in theory sounds like it could be interesting.

I mean those people like those Nazi zombie games right? But the execution leaves a lot to be desired. To economically handle mobs of aliens just shoot a barrel once and walk with it in front of you. When you see a mob approaching take a few steps back and shoot the barrel for a free explosion. Mob problem solved. There are multiple weapons but they end up being more for visual effect rather than effectively or creatively taking down alien hordes.

The only good thing about this game are the controls. They're simple and straight forward. But even for the multiplayer aspect I have to say there are a number of other games to choose. Nothing in particular sets this game apart from the rest. Not even it's predictable lackluster story.

reviewText:
Burgers is not about food, and doesn't appear to involve consuming food at any point. It's sort of like a Golden Axe/Castle Crashers style game, set in WWII, but is it poorly executed right now and needs a lot of refining. Not sure how the now applies.

As soon as you start a game, you are presented with typing errors. Once you get into the gameplay, it's very simple, and you can skip all the monsters and just run to the right to complete the level.

A short while layer, some kind of alien looking giant bugs leap out of haystacks, before you encounter the first boss fight. I fought the boss for five minutes, circling him and shooting him repeatedly, but his health didn't budge. I remembered I had grenades, so tossed one at his feet, and a third of his health disappeared.

I decided I'd played enough. It's a good start, but has a long way to go before it is fun to play.

reviewText:
+ I like the artwork (characters, enemies and weapons).
- The gameplay is very repetitive and not in a fun way that keeps it interesting for me.
- The sounds of enemies getting hurt or dying could use some variety in my opinion.
- In story mode, the second boss has a hit detection system that will make you bleed when you're not even close to him anymore.
- The menu interface is buggy and will crash easily, or at least it does on my computer.

Note: The game didn't log my playing time properly; I played for about an hour, not the five minutes Steam logged.
